text: Medyka (; ) is a village in Przemyśl County, Subcarpathian Voivodeship, in south-eastern Poland, on the border with Ukraine. It is the seat of the gmina (administrative district) called Gmina Medyka. It lies approximately east of Przemyśl and east of the regional capital Rzeszów. Between 1939 and 1948 the village belonged to the Drohobych Oblast of the Ukrainian SSR. In 2006 the village had a population of approximately 2,800. ==Border crossing== One of the main road border crossings between Poland and Ukraine is located there. One of the main rail lines between Poland and Ukraine runs through the village and crosses the border nearby. The town across the border in Ukraine is Shehyni. ==References== Category:Villages in Przemyśl County Category:Poland–Ukraine border crossings
title: Medyka
